# status

**Instance Property**

A status that indicates the object’s ability to loop playback.

## Declaration

```swift
var status: AVPlayerLooper.Status { get }
```

## Discussion

When the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVPlayerLooper/Status-swift.enum/failed] or [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVPlayerLooper/Status-swift.enum/cancelled], you can no longer use the looper for playback. You need to create a new instance to begin looping again.

This property is key-value observable.

## Observing looping state

- **loopCount**: The number of times the object played the media.
- **AVPlayerLooper.Status**: Status constants that indicate whether a looper can successfully perform looping playback.
